I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

[/oxy_rich_text][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='002a0e619b420d7617ce3cde3731d80c8eaa599734c1eb3fa4323106101a71ee' ct_options='{"ct_id":2184,"ct_parent":2227,"selector":"_rich_text-2184-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.3","padding-top":"8","padding-left":"16","padding-right":"16","padding-bottom":"8"},"activeselector":false,"media":{"page-width":{"original":{}},"tablet":{"original":{"text-align":"left"}}}}']I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute for Artificial Intelligence. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo. In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor

  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the metalab project

  • April 28th 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Aritifical Intelligence2020-21

  • April 27th 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto

  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! Went back to Canada

  • August 14th 2019: Started working with Dr. Sho Tsujiat IRCN on an robot-infant interaction experiment

  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Labbetween Harvard University and IRCN

  • Nov 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology

  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto

  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE and presented my undergraduate thesis project, won best undergraduate poster award

  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute for Artificial Intelligence. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo. In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor

  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the metalab project

  • April 28th 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Aritifical Intelligence2020-21

  • April 27th 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto

  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! Went back to Canada

  • August 14th 2019: Started working with Dr. Sho Tsujiat IRCN on an robot-infant interaction experiment

  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Labbetween Harvard University and IRCN

  • Nov 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology

  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto

  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE and presented my undergraduate thesis project, won best undergraduate poster award

  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute for Artificial Intelligence. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo. In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the metalab project
  • April 28th 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Aritifical Intelligence2020-21
  • April 27th 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! Went back to Canada
  • August 14th 2019: Started working with Dr. Sho Tsujiat IRCN on an robot-infant interaction experiment
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Labbetween Harvard University and IRCN
  • Nov 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE and presented my undergraduate thesis project, won best undergraduate poster award
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto

[/ct_headline][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='b61d1cd4c2827077499cf4515b9c6217279660865b4fa3c8eebeda898b801050' ct_options='{"ct_id":2143,"ct_parent":2017,"selector":"_rich_text-2143-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","text-align":"left","margin-top":"15","margin-left":"15","margin-right":"15","margin-bottom":"15","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.5","font-weight":"300","font-family":"Inherit"},"activeselector":false}']

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute for Artificial Intelligence. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the metalab project
  • April 28th 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Aritifical Intelligence2020-21
  • April 27th 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! Went back to Canada
  • August 14th 2019: Started working with Dr. Sho Tsujiat IRCN on an robot-infant interaction experiment
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Labbetween Harvard University and IRCN
  • Nov 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE and presented my undergraduate thesis project, won best undergraduate poster award
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto

[/ct_headline][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='b61d1cd4c2827077499cf4515b9c6217279660865b4fa3c8eebeda898b801050' ct_options='{"ct_id":2143,"ct_parent":2017,"selector":"_rich_text-2143-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","text-align":"left","margin-top":"15","margin-left":"15","margin-right":"15","margin-bottom":"15","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.5","font-weight":"300","font-family":"Inherit"},"activeselector":false}']

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute for Artificial Intelligence. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the metalab project
  • April 28th 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Aritifical Intelligence2020-21
  • April 27th 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ?? Went back to Canada
  • August 14th 2019: Started working with Dr. Sho Tsujiat IRCN on an robot-infant interaction experiment
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Labbetween Harvard University and IRCN
  • Nov 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE and presented my undergraduate thesis project, won best undergraduate poster award
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto

[/ct_headline][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='5a5bd3f3f01a5152ff2e45eb888a07d6454ff2d333ad30cc26091c35fafd5fbd' ct_options='{"ct_id":2143,"ct_parent":2017,"selector":"_rich_text-2143-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","text-align":"left","margin-top":"15","margin-left":"15","margin-right":"15","margin-bottom":"15","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.5","font-weight":"300","font-family":"Inherit"},"activeselector":false}']

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

[/oxy_rich_text][ct_link_button ct_sign_sha256='00c4b5f7c01470c32d41715a4f7bd79b49a3516e7b7e7f65e6031684479652b9'   • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

[/ct_headline][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='5a5bd3f3f01a5152ff2e45eb888a07d6454ff2d333ad30cc26091c35fafd5fbd' ct_options='{"ct_id":2143,"ct_parent":2017,"selector":"_rich_text-2143-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","text-align":"left","margin-top":"15","margin-left":"15","margin-right":"15","margin-bottom":"15","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.5","font-weight":"300","font-family":"Inherit"},"activeselector":false}']

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

In addition, I recently worked on metalab at Stanford University and on social network analysis with Dr. Joel Levine at the University of Toronto.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

[/oxy_rich_text][ct_link_button ct_sign_sha256='00c4b5f7c01470c32d41715a4f7bd79b49a3516e7b7e7f65e6031684479652b9'   • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

[/ct_headline][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='5a5bd3f3f01a5152ff2e45eb888a07d6454ff2d333ad30cc26091c35fafd5fbd' ct_options='{"ct_id":2143,"ct_parent":2017,"selector":"_rich_text-2143-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","text-align":"left","margin-top":"15","margin-left":"15","margin-right":"15","margin-bottom":"15","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.5","font-weight":"300","font-family":"Inherit"},"activeselector":false}']

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

[/oxy_rich_text][ct_link_button ct_sign_sha256='00c4b5f7c01470c32d41715a4f7bd79b49a3516e7b7e7f65e6031684479652b9'   • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

  • September 1st, 2020: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • May 1st, 2020: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • April 28th, 2020: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • April 27th, 2020: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • February 4th, 2020: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • August 14th, 2019: Started working with Dr Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • November 6th, 2018: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • November 5th, 2018: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • May 13th, 2018: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • July 8th, 2018: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • April 22nd, 2017: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. Ness and Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto, Dr. Takao Hensch at Harvard University, and Dr. Sho Tsuji at the International Research Center for Neurointelligence, University of Tokyo.

  • 2021/1/11: Started working at the Vector Institute as a health AI intern.
  • 2021/1/7: Started a teaching assistant position for Engineering Analysis at the University of Guelph.
  • 2020/12/1: Started a COVID-19 related project as an AI research Scientist at the Public Health Agency of Canada.
  • 2020/9/1: Joined the Machine Learning Research Group at the University of Guelph and the Vector Institute as a MASc student, supervised by Dr. Graham Taylor.
  • 2020/5/1: Started working at Stanford University on the Metalab.
  • 2020/4/28: Selected as a recipient for the Vector Scholarship in Artificial Intelligence 2020-21!
  • 2020/4/27: Started working at the Levine Lab at the University of Toronto.
  • 2020/2/4: Marked one year living in Tokyo, Japan! ??
  • 2019/8/14: Started working with Dr. Sho Tsujiat IRCN, the University of Tokyo.
  • 2018/11/6: Started working at the Hensch Lab between Harvard University and IRCN.
  • 2018/11/5: Graduated from the University of Toronto with Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and Biology.?
  • 2018/5/13: Started my research project with Dr. Andreas Hilfinger at the University of Toronto.
  • 2018/7/8: Went to my first conference, SMBE , and presented my undergraduate thesis project, awarded best undergraduate poster.
  • 2017/4/22: Started doing research at the Ness Lab at the University of Toronto.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

[/oxy_rich_text][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='002a0e619b420d7617ce3cde3731d80c8eaa599734c1eb3fa4323106101a71ee' ct_options='{"ct_id":2184,"ct_parent":2227,"selector":"_rich_text-2184-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.3","padding-top":"8","padding-left":"16","padding-right":"16","padding-bottom":"8"},"activeselector":false,"media":{"page-width":{"original":{}},"tablet":{"original":{"text-align":"left"}}}}']I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like pia coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Genetic Networks & Selection at the University of Toronto
item.dc:creator: gqdmsxmr-ca
item.content:encoded:
While working with Dr. Rob Ness, we studied the effect of certain network measures on natural selection in two types of biological networks for the green algae, Chlamydomonas reinhardtii: co-expression and metabolic. We quantified selection by finding estimates for divergence and diversity measures and looked at two specific network measures: betweenness centrality and connectivity. We also looked at how the networks predict the distribution of fitness effects of new mutations, and how the rate of adaptive evolution varies across the networks.

I presented part of this work at the SMBE conference in Yokohama, Japan, where I won the best undergraduate poster award.

(Manuscript in preparation)

Github repo

item.title: Infant-Robot Interaction project at IRCN, the University of Tokyo
item.dc:creator: gqdmsxmr-ca
item.content:encoded:
While working with Dr. Sho Tsuji, I co-developed a humanoid robot-infant interaction experiment which contrasts a robot that emits social cues with one that does not, and assesses an infants social reaction in these two conditions.

I was in charge of programming the humanoid robot, Nao, which included implementing various well-matched social and non-social gestures, features that made the experiment engaging to infants, creating a user-friendly GUI, and experimental randomization procedures. 

Github Repo

item.title: Social Network Analysis at Harvard University, IRCN
item.dc:creator: gqdmsxmr-ca
item.content:encoded:
At the Hensch lab, we analyzed the effects of early-life experiences on social network organization in mice. Networks consisted of only male or only female mice, some exhibiting early-life stress. For each network, we looked at individual and social network organization by analyzing network measures such as clustering, global efficiency, and outdegree centrality.

(Manuscript in preparation)

Github Repo

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

[/oxy_rich_text][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='6b4859758224ee2913cbbf27313ac4c3d889eecdee53f452d1b98910e35b45f2' ct_options='{"ct_id":2184,"ct_parent":2227,"selector":"_rich_text-2184-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.3","padding-top":"8","padding-left":"8","padding-right":"8","padding-bottom":"8"},"activeselector":false,"media":{"page-width":{"original":{}},"tablet":{"original":{"text-align":"left"}}}}']I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

[/oxy_rich_text][oxy_rich_text ct_sign_sha256='002a0e619b420d7617ce3cde3731d80c8eaa599734c1eb3fa4323106101a71ee' ct_options='{"ct_id":2184,"ct_parent":2227,"selector":"_rich_text-2184-18","original":{"color":"#ffffff","font-size-unit":"em","font-size":"1.3","padding-top":"8","padding-left":"16","padding-right":"16","padding-bottom":"8"},"activeselector":false,"media":{"page-width":{"original":{}},"tablet":{"original":{"text-align":"left"}}}}']I graduated from the University of Toronto with an Honours Bachelor of Science, double major in Computer Science and Biology. My previous research experience includes working with Dr. Rob W. I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.

I am a MASc candidate in CSAI at the University of Guelph advised by Dr. Graham Taylor where I am a member of the Machine Learning Research Group and the Vector Institute. My current research interests include deep learning, natural language processing, and genomics.
